string.text: File

A weapon cleaning file crafted from high-carbon steel, offering precision and durability for maintaining the parts of various firearms. It has fine and uniform teeth to effectively remove rust, burrs, and fouling from metal surfaces. An ergonomic handle provides a comfortable grip for precise control in delicate repair tasks. Files of different sizes are commonly used in repair workshops and camps for maintaining weapon parts, an essential task for preventing malfunctions and extending the lifespan of carried weaponry.

Multitool

A multi-tool made from high quality stainless steel, designed for a wide number of crafting and repair tasks. Includes a line-up of precision screwdrivers, pliers, wire cutters, and a small blade, all housed in a compact, foldable design. Enables disassembly and maintenance of electronic devices, weapons, and other equipment. The tool's versatility and durability make it indispensable for field repairs and adjustments and is also found in many workshops. Each implement locks securely in place, ensuring safe and reliable use during intricate tasks. Though it can be used for a multitude of tasks, its smaller components may require periodic tightening and lubrication to maintain optimal performance and bigger tools and repair kits may be more suited.

Ramrod

A ramrod constructed from lightweight aluminum, essential for cleaning and restoring firearm parts. It features a threaded end for attaching various brushes and jags, allowing thorough removal of debris and fouling from barrels and chambers. The ramrod's sectional design enables easy storage and transport, making it a practical tool for field maintenance. Its robust construction ensures longevity, though repeated use may lead to minor bending that should be inspected for periodically. A widely used item by technical military personnel, stalkers, and hunters for firearms maintenance and repair tasks.

Universal Weapon Part Cleaning Kit

A universal weapon part cleaning kit, designed to maintain firearms of all common calibers and keep them in optimal working condition. The kit includes a small portion of high-efficiency lubricant and cleaning solvent for thorough removal of residue and other contaminants often accumulating in extensively used equipment. Additionally, it contains a number of light tools, such as brushes, picks, and cloths to access inner mechanisms and hard-to-reach areas. It comes in a compact case for both use in the field and inside workshops. Regular use of this kit helps prevent malfunctions and extends the lifespan of firearms and may restore a heavily used item to a condition where it can be maintained by less expensive methods. Ensure proper ventilation when using included solvents during cleaning.

Sewing Thread

A roll of nylon sewing thread, commonly chosen for universal outfit repairs for its durability and resilience. This high-tensile thread is resistant to abrasion, moisture, and UV light, ideal for mending protective equipment and clothing in any condition. The smooth texture of the material allows for easy threading and consistent stitches. While exceptionally strong, the thread can sometimes slip through fabric more easily than cotton, necessitating secure knotting. Sewing thread is often included in military-issue repair kits and used by virtually all outfit vendors and mechanics. It is advised to use it in conjunction with high quality spare fabrics for more effective repairs.

Field Armor Repair Kit

A well-equipped military kit for armor repairs in the field. The kit includes patches, adhesive, and specialized tools to mend and reinforce body armor and tactical gear. It contains multiple rolls of Kevlar thread, a material with exceptional strength and resistance to heat and abrasion for reliable stitching, suited for equipment repairs that need to endure extended combat scenarios. The kit's components are organized in a compact, weather-resistant case for rapid, on-the-go repairs. While highly effective, the Kevlar thread can be challenging to cut and requires a specialized cutter and demands some tailoring experience from the user. It provides an effective alternative to repair services offered by various workshops in the Zone.

Cleaning Solvent ("Hoppe's No. 9")

A high-quality, Western-made firearm cleaning solvent designed for lubricating and protecting firearms. It requires appropriate tools for proper application, making it an additive rather than a standalone solution. Known for its distinctive smell, "Hoppe's No. 9" has been a staple in firearm maintenance for decades. Commonly used for cleaning barrels, actions, and other metal parts, users should ensure the solvent is thoroughly removed to avoid residue buildup, which can attract dirt and impair function.

Spray Lubricant ("Brunox Gun Care")

A spray can containing oil intended for lubricating and protecting firearms. Frequent application will prevent guns from malfunctioning and corroding. The aerosol nature of "Brunox" allows for easy distribution in hard-to-reach areas, but users must be careful to wipe off excess to prevent attracting dust and debris. Ideal for quick maintenance sessions, though it should be paired with more thorough cleaning routines for best results.

Cleaning Solvent ("Dvojka")

An iconic Red Army oil that has been in service for almost 70 years, intended for lubricating and protecting firearms. The metal bottle is divided into two compartments, one for oil and the other for cleaning solvent. Its robust design makes it suitable for field use. Users should be attentive when applying "Dvojka" to ensure even coverage and avoid over-lubrication, which can lead to residue buildup and subsequent jamming of moving parts.

Gun Oil ("Rusak")

A plastic bottle containing budget Russian mineral gun oil intended for lubricating and protecting firearms. Its affordable nature makes it a common choice for cost-conscious users. However, like other oils, it requires appropriate tools for proper application. "Rusak" should be applied sparingly to avoid excess oil that can attract dust and debris, and it is best used as part of a comprehensive cleaning routine rather than on its own.

Sewing Kit (Basic)

A light sewing kit consisting of a cloth reel, several steel needles, and a pair of scissors. Suitable for sewing up bullet holes or ruptures in soft fabrics of outfits. Users should ensure to match the thread type to the fabric to maintain durability and avoid additional damage. A common choice for simple mending tasks like tears and rips in non-reinforced materials.

Sewing Kit (Advanced)

An advanced sewing kit containing double reels of nylon thread and a large selection of higher-quality needles, suitable for working on thicker and harder materials, including lighter mutant skins and artificial fibers. Users should select appropriate needle sizes and thread tension to prevent material damage. It is the most common choice for field repairs and generally contains better sewing accessories than its more basic counterpart.

Sewing Kit (Heavy)

A military-grade heavy sewing kit, primarily designed to handle fractures in protective plates of modern combat armors. It contains enough metallic thread to put together outfits that have literally been torn apart. Capable of sewing on even the hardest of mutant hides, users should ensure to apply consistent pressure to avoid weakening the stitches. Usually stocked in most workshops and carried and used by mechanics for extended patching.

Glue Tube ("M17")

A tube of high quality universal adhesive. M17 is the result of a Soviet military-industrial research project intended to devise an extremely potent, single-ingredient adhesive that could be used in any situation regardless of purpose and the materials involved. There is almost no damage that the glue won't be able to repair. Effective on virtually all materials used for worn protective gear, backpacks, tents, and other pieces of gear. Glue should be sparingly and surfaces must be clean and dry before application to maximize adhesion strength. M17 is a popular choice for emergency repairs of expensive equipment and is considered a top of the line glue.

Glue Tube ("Tur")

A tube of a modified epoxy-based adhesive, produced by the Ukrainian chemical industry for quick binding of most solid materials. The glue binds both textile fabrics and lighter protective materials like Kevlar, but is useless when it comes to metals. Users should allow adequate curing time for maximum bond strength and ensure that bonded surfaces are held together securely during the drying process. It is a common above-entry-level glue for basic repair tasks when more advanced equipment is not available.

Glue Tube ("Zviezda")

A versatile epoxy-based solution for repair and patching work. Zviezda is a synthetic adhesive with reasonable strength and durablity. It may be used with fitting replacement pieces to mend torn clothing and equipment. While cost-effective, it is less durable than higher-end products and should be primarily used for temporary repairs. Users should clean and roughen the surfaces before application to improve the adhesive bond. It is cheapest of the synthetic adhesives available in the Zone.

A lightweight repair kit designed for maintaining light armor. It includes ultra-durable threads, needles, and polymer-based patches. Effective for repairing materials such as heavy cloth and light Kevlar sheets, this kit is essential for ensuring the integrity of lightly armored vests and jackets. Users should be meticulous in applying the patches to ensure a secure bond and avoid additional wear.

Users should take care to follow precise repair protocols to maintain the suit's functionality and its overall integrity.

A specialized kit for repairing modern combat helmets. It features heavy-duty tools and materials, including Kevlar, steel, and titanium components, as well as a strong methacrylate-based adhesive. Effective for restoring structural integrity, users should ensure all repairs are securely bonded and thoroughly tested for durability under stress.

Sharpening Stone Set

An assortment of different grit sharpening stones for everyday maintenance of blades and knives, packed in a durable polyester bag. The set includes coarse, medium, and fine grit stones for a range of sharpening tasks, from initial edge restoration to final honing. Each stone is made from silicon carbide, providing reliable performance for routine sharpening needs. The bag makes the set portable and keeps the stones organized and protected. While effective for most sharpening tasks, the stones may wear down over time and require occasional resurfacing. Not suited for serrated blades.
